props.title: Our process
props.description: We specialize in creating bold, eye-catching designs that are perfect for t-shirts, posters, stickers, and more. Whether you need a small run of custom t-shirts for your business or a large order of promotional materials for an event, we can help. Here's a glimpse of our process below

milestones.label: Design Creation
milestones.description: The first step in screen printing is to create the design that will be printed. This design is typically created using graphic design software and is saved as a high-resolution file.

milestones.label: Screen Preparation
milestones.description: Once the design is created, a mesh screen is prepared by coating it with a light-sensitive emulsion. The emulsion is then allowed to dry, and the design is printed onto a transparent film.

milestones.label: Exposure
milestones.description: The printed film is placed on the prepared screen and exposed to a bright light. The light hardens the emulsion on the screen, except for the areas where the design has been printed. These areas remain soft and can be washed away later.

milestones.label: Washing
milestones.description: After exposure, the screen is washed with water, which removes the soft emulsion, leaving the design on the screen.

milestones.label: Ink Preparation
milestones.description: The ink is mixed and prepared according to the color and type of substrate being printed on.

milestones.label: Printing
milestones.description: The substrate is placed on the printing press, and the screen is placed on top of it. Ink is then poured onto the screen and spread across it using a squeegee. The ink is forced through the mesh and onto the substrate, creating the printed design.

milestones.label: Drying and Curing
milestones.description: After printing, the substrate is dried and cured to ensure that the ink is fully set and will not smudge or wash away.

props.title: Our Most Popular Servcies
props.subtitle: Our Services
props.description: We offer a wide range of screen printing services to meet your needs. Whether you're looking for custom t-shirts, posters, stickers, or other promotional materials, we have you covered. Here are some of our most popular services:

services.title: Custom T-Shirts
services.description: Custom t-shirts are a great way to promote your business or event, and we specialize in creating high-quality, eye-catching designs that are sure to get noticed. We offer a variety of t-shirt styles and colors to choose from, and we can print your design in up to 6 colors for maximum impact.

services.title: Posters
services.description: Posters are a classic way to promote concerts, events, and other happenings. We can print your design on high-quality poster paper in sizes ranging from 11x17 inches to 24x36 inches. We can also print your design on other materials, such as foam board, for a more durable option.

services.title: Bags and Totes
services.description: Custom bags and totes are a great way to promote your business while providing a useful item for your customers. We offer a variety of bag and tote styles to choose from, and we can print your design in up to 6 colors for maximum impact.

faqs.question: What is screen printing?
faqs.answer: Screen printing is a printing technique that involves using a mesh stencil (or "screen") to transfer ink onto a substrate, such as a t-shirt, poster, or sticker.

faqs.question: What types of materials can be screen printed?
faqs.answer: Screen printing can be done on a wide variety of materials, including fabric, paper, metal, glass, and plastic.

faqs.question: What are the advantages of screen printing?
faqs.answer: Screen printing is a versatile and cost-effective printing method that can produce high-quality, long-lasting prints. It can also be used to print on a wide range of materials and is suitable for both large and small production runs.

faqs.question: What is the process of screen printing?
faqs.answer: The process of screen printing involves creating a stencil, or "screen" of the design to be printed, which is then placed over the substrate. Ink is then applied to the screen and forced through the mesh onto the substrate using a squeegee. This process can be repeated for multiple colors or layers.

faqs.question: What types of designs are suitable for screen printing?
faqs.answer: Screen printing is best suited for designs with bold, solid colors or simple, graphic shapes. It is less suitable for designs with fine details or complex gradients.

faqs.question: What is the turnaround time for a screen printing order?
faqs.answer: Turnaround times for screen printing orders can vary depending on the size of the order and the complexity of the design. Generally, orders can be completed within a few days to a few weeks.

faqs.question: Can I provide my own artwork for screen printing?
faqs.answer: Yes, most screen printing companies will accept customer-provided artwork. However, it is important to ensure that the artwork meets certain technical specifications to ensure the best possible print quality.
